sub_title: Product Owner at ASML | Changing the world, one nanometer at a time
summary:
Motivated and pro-active individual with professional background of Project Management, Production Management (Planning, Scheduling & Resources Management) and Top-Down Corporate Decision Making; and academic background with an amalgam of Engineering and Management.  

With proven leadership and team-player skills in various professional and personal level projects and initiatives, in a multi-cultural working environment, I am a servant leader, adept at identifying problems and solving them through strategic planning and implementation of corrective actions through a collaborative approach. 

I am determined to acquire new skills, polish existing ones and work in a multi-cultural, cohesive and team-driven working environment.

school.name: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Engineering - BE (Undergraduate Exchange Program)

awards.title: Youth Pass
awards.description: This award was given after successful completion of week long Erasmus+ Youth Exchange in Tarnow, Poland under the European Union's Erasmus+ program. This youth exchange titled "EU Youth Online" was aimed at creating awareness about role of social media in development of EU youth, inculcating team-building skills and promoting cultural exchange.

awards.title: Harvard Impact Challenge - 2nd Prize
awards.description: As an international delegate, representing Pakistan, I won 2nd Prize in the Harvard Impact Challenge, for presenting a viable solution to an ongoing project of Deloitte (world’s largest professional services provider), in front of its senior executives.

awards.title: ESD Ambassador - UNESCO
awards.description:
I was among the two youth activists selected from Pakistan and 30 activists from Asia - Pacific to participate in the training at UNESCO Bangkok office. The title of the conference was 'The Asia Pacific Regional Workshop for Youth Leadership Training on Education for Sustainable Development'.  Before and after the conference I carried out multiple projects under the umbrella of United Nations Global Action Program (UN GAP-ESD). 

These projects were aimed at: 
1. Creating educational awareness among youth of Pakistan
2. Promoting religious tolerance through dialogue 
3. Empowering the youth for their rights and career development 
4. Cultural integration and empowerment of youth from underprivileged areas 
5. Advocacy for implementation of article for Right to Education (RTE)

After the successful completion of week long training aimed at creating awareness about SDGs and their significance in development of the world, at UNESCO Bangkok office, I was awarded the ESD Ambassador title along with the other 30 youth icons selected from all over Asia.

awards.title: NUST High Achiever Award
awards.description: I received this award for getting selected for fully funded Global UGrad Pakistan Fall 2015 program to study at Florida Gulf Coast University, FL, U.S.
awards.issuer: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)

awards.title: NUST High Achiever Award
awards.description: This award was presented to me for receiving PKR 0.5 million funding from U.S. Embassy Pakistan and leading an amazing two months long project, Career Pathways towards Higher Education, in the remote northern area of Pakistan. Through this project I reached out to 2770 students from 6 districts of Gilgit-Baltistan to create education awareness in that region and mobilized the youth and youth organizations there to work for promoting the need for higher education in that region. It was the first and largest project of this scale executed in that region.
awards.issuer: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.description: Made it to the top 15% students of the engineering college at Florida Gulf Coast University!
awards.issuer: Whitaker College of Engineering, Florida Gulf Coast University.

awards.title: Cultural Ambassador of Pakistan
awards.description: Upon successful completion of the Global UGRAD semester exchange program at Florida Gulf Coast University, I was given the title of Cultural Ambassador of Pakistan, to be registered at Department of States forever!

awards.title: NUST High Achiever Award
awards.description: As the Vice President of NUST Education for Empowerment Program, I led multiple projects aimed at community development through education. These projects contributed towards winning the first ever McJannet Global Citizenship Award for NUST out of 350 universities competing from all over the world. I was later awarded the university's High Achiever Award for this accomplishment.
awards.issuer: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)

certifications.name: Professional Scrum Product Owner™ I (PSPO I)

projects.title: Stef: from B2B to B2C Market (e-grocery)
projects.description: While working with the managers of STEF Italia we analyzed the company’s existing logistics (WMS and TMS) services along with other competitors in market (including Amazon) and over a time period of 3 months proposed a plan, solution and strategy to enter into B2C market (e-grocery) in Italy. The solution focused on e-commerce trends and specifically smart consumers.

contributors.headline: Product Owner at ASML | Changing the world, one nanometer at a time

projects.title: National Youth Coalition for Education (NYCE)
projects.description: As an initiative aimed to mobilize and aware youth and youth led organizations of Pakistan for the cause of education, it brought together thousands of youth and hundreds of youth organizations across Pakistan on a single platform, through seminars, policy dialogues with government representatives, awareness movements on ground and on social media and university level awareness sessions, for the cause of Right to Education (RTE)

contributors.headline: Product Owner at ASML | Changing the world, one nanometer at a time

projects.title: English Access Youth Activism
projects.description: As a project leader, I brought together 50 young students from different areas of Pakistan to participate in NUST Olympiad '17, experience university culture, learn more about the international exchange opportunities and experience diversity and competition at a university level.

contributors.headline: Product Owner at ASML | Changing the world, one nanometer at a time

projects.title: Career Pathways towards Higher Education-GB
projects.description: With a 60L backpack, a folding bicycle and loads of commitment I started my journey towards remote areas in the north of Pakistan with the mission to empower students from less-privileged class for making well-informed career decisions and follow paths leading to higher education. During 47 days in mountains I covered six districts of Gilgit-Baltistan and targeted 2770 students during the 33 career counselling sessions organized in the secondary and high schools.

contributors.headline: Product Owner at ASML | Changing the world, one nanometer at a time

profile_positions.description:
Mission: To support the actions of Corporate Manufacturing with the aim of ensuring correct sizing of production units, in line with the agreed volume and efficiency targets, and effective coordination of continuous improvement activities. 

Responsibilities: 
- Analyze the defined industrial budget and transform it into a plan for the development and sizing of the production capacity for each production unit, with the aim of fully achieving the required targets.
- Support the action of the production units, both Italian and foreign, by analyzing the organization and efficiencies of the lines and monitoring process times and lead times.
- Ensure the availability and updating of the industrial parameters necessary for the correct costing of the product.
- Ensure continuity in the planning, execution, monitoring and finalization process of the improvement actions generated within the production units.
---By personally managing projects across the production units.
---Support the action of improvement project teams.
- Develop the culture of eliminating waste.
profile_positions.title: Production Efficiency Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Working in Operations section of the Company my Key contributions and activities have had been:
   - Process Transfer (from MicroFabrica, USA to Technoprobe, Italy) and setting up its Production Line
   - Developing Analytical/Statistical tools and models for Top-Down Corporate Decision Making
   - Introduction and Implementation of Production Planning and Scheduling
   - Analyzing and Defining Production/Manufacturing Capacities of different units of the company
   - Introduction and Implementation of Lean Manufacturing concepts in different units of the company
   - Monitoring and Supervision of Continuous Improvement projects using the PDCA approach
profile_positions.title: Process Transfer Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Analyze the production flow and the supply chain with respect to the product flow
•	Minimize Lead Time on SMT Line and identify all required changes
•	Evaluate the supply chain and design the best strategy to optimize the SMT process
•	Design the warehouse to support the chosen strategy
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
My key responsibilities included:

1. Monitoring and Evaluation, documentation and administration of projects
2. Detailed planning of projects on Primavera, MS Project and MS Excel
3. Monitoring cash flows and examining weekly, monthly and quarterly progress reports, and providing technical supervision/advisory
profile_positions.title: Graduate Trainee Engineer

profile_positions.description:
My key responsibilities included:
1. Corporate Strategy Formulation and Operational Management of the organization
2. Carrying out tasks of Project Documentation and Business Plan writing
3. Managing (from idea conception to closing) various projects, supported by UNESCO and Open Society Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Project Director

company.name: Republic of Turkey Ministry of Youth and Sports

volunteer_experiences.description:
As part of the European Volunteer Services (EVS) - Erasmus+, I volunteered for one month with the Turkish Ministry of Youth and Sports in one of their Summer Youth Camps, i.e. Bolu Aladag Camp. It was located in the city of Bolu and during my one month as volunteer I:

1. Acted as activity leader for various outdoor activities for 400 female campers. 
2. Conducted Cultural Awareness Session to promote need of exchanges among youth. 
3. Worked with camp organizers in planning and execution of activities.

Working with AIESEC Milano (Local Committee of AIESEC Italia) for more than a term, in the Outgoing Global Volunteer department (oGV), I promoted cultural exchange within and outside European countries by guiding and mentoring the Italian youth for Global Volunteering projects based on SDGs.

I became member of Pakistan-U.S. Alumni Network (PUAN) after successful completion of a semester exchange at Florida Gulf Coast University under the Global UGRAD Program administered by IREX through U.S. Department of States. As part of this alumni network I: 

1. Participated in Organizing Teams of various international conferences held in Pakistan.
2. Carried out various projects, in individual as well as a group capacity, aimed at community development. 
3. As a representative of 22000+ alumni across Pakistan, represented this Network in front of U.S. Senators, different social media platforms, Radio Pakistan and numerous other platforms  to create awareness about cultural exchanges among youth of Pakistan.
